name: Pecan Pralines: He Says Pray-leen, I Say Prah-leen
description: This confection may have French roots but it most definitely has a special place in the South too. That's why I get a little twangy and call them pecan prah-leens whereas my boyfriend, who studied French for seven-odd years, is all about the pray-leen pronunciation.

recipeInstructions.text: Bring the sugars, cream, butter, and salt to a boil. Cook, stirring occasionally for about four minutes.
Stir in the pecans. Return to a boil and cook, stirring constantly, for about one more minute.
Remove from heat and spoon onto parchment-lined baking sheets. Let set at room temperature until completely cool.
